title: Indian Chapati Bread Recipe
description: Chapati is a traditional Indian flatbread that's easy to make on the stovetop with simple pantry ingredients: wheat flour, oil, salt, and water.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Global Cuisines Asian Indian Bread Indian Chapati Bread 4.7 (226) 166 Reviews 38 Photos This chapati recipe is simple and delicious. Serve this Indian bread with curries or use it as a sandwich wrap. Enjoy! Submitted by INSHA87 Updated on April 9, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 38 38 38 38 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 10 chapatis Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 1 cup whole wheat flour 1 cup all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon salt ¾ cup hot water or as needed 2 tablespoons olive oil or vegetable oil Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, and salt in a large bowl. Use a wooden spoon to stir in water and oil. Mix until a soft, elastic dough forms and add more water, if needed. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Divide dough into 10 equal portions, or less if you want larger chapatis. Roll each piece into a ball and let rest for a few minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a lightly greased skillet over medium heat. Use a rolling pin to roll dough balls out on a lightly floured surface until very thin. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios When the skillet starts to smoke, place a chapati in it. Cook until bottom has brown spots, about 30 seconds, then flip and cook 30 seconds more. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Repeat to cook remaining chapatis. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 316 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 110 Calories 3g Fat 18g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 110 % Daily Value * Total Fat 3g 4% Saturated Fat 0g 2% Sodium 234mg 10% Total Carbohydrate 18g 7% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 0g Protein 3g 6% Calcium 7mg 1% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 62mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Indian Chapati Bread 01 of 38 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 38 Photo by  Liralen Li 02/26/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort I used Indian multigrain Atta, but followed it with half the salt and the long rest after mixing and before balling and shaping... and ended up cooking the first side a little, putting it onto the second side on the griddle, but when it started puffing, I put the breads onto an open flame and they toasted beautifully and puffed completely through! I put them into a towel, and they stayed soft and pliable all through a dinner of Chana Dal. It was *so* good. 03 of 38 Photo by  aimeeferraiolo 02/23/2022 Absolutely delicious my first time ever trying to make this and my husband and children were asking for more thank you for this easy recipe 04 of 38 Photo by  Eve 02/04/2022 Easy to make. Fairly quickly done. Nice and crispy. Maybe a bit tough...but I'm no expert on Chapatis; maybe they're supposed to be fairly tough.I suspect the secret to making them crispy is to roll them out REALLY thin. I rolled them paper thin. 05 of 38 Photo by  bjf9t4v6bp 12/10/2021 Dough turned great non- sticky and easy to work with. I added some kalonji and toasted sesame seeds. I love this recipe. I think I will use this dough to make samosas as well. 06 of 38 Photo by  bjf9t4v6bp 12/10/2021 Dough turned great non- sticky and easy to work with. I added some kalonji and toasted sesame seeds. I love this recipe. I think I will use this dough to make samosas as well. 07 of 38 Photo by  19tlincoln 12/22/2020 08 of 38 Photo by  jennianderson22 10/27/2020 09 of 38 Photo by  Erin Fritz Krueger 10/15/2020 10 of 38 Photo by  Megan 10/02/2020 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Whole Wheat Chapati 39 Ratings Potato Chapati Bread 6 Ratings Wheat Dosa Green Onion Garlic Naan Bread 15 Ratings Aloo Paratha Parathas 1 Rating Naan 2,638 Ratings Roti Bread from India 69 Ratings Banana Chai Bread 96 Ratings Whole Wheat Molasses Flat Bread 21 Ratings Mexican Whole Wheat Flour Tortillas 370 Ratings Irish Soda Bread with Buttermilk Roti Canai/Paratha (Indian Pancake) 9 Ratings Akki Rotti 9 Ratings Perfectly Moist Irish Wheaten Bread 68 Ratings Whole Wheat Wraps 60 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
